# Chapter 13: Designing UI with v0

Time to see what ReadStack will look like.

**Time required:** 20 minutes

**What you'll get:** Four beautiful, production-ready components generated by AI.

---

## What is v0?

v0 turns text descriptions into React components.

**You write:** "Create a login form with email and password"

**v0 generates:**
- Complete Next.js component
- shadcn/ui components included
- Tailwind CSS styling
- TypeScript types
- Responsive design
- Accessible HTML

All in 10-20 seconds.

**No manual coding. No CSS. No component library setup.**

---

## The Four Components You'll Generate

1. **Authentication pages** (login, signup, password reset)
2. **Dashboard** (article list with tabs and stats)
3. **Save URL dialog** (modal for adding new articles)
4. **Article detail page** (view and edit individual articles)

Each takes 3-5 minutes.

---

## Component 1: Authentication Pages

### Open v0

Go to [v0.dev](https://v0.dev) in your browser.

Click "New" (the big button in the center).

![Screenshot: v0 homepage](#placeholder-v0-homepage)

### Paste This Prompt

Copy everything between the lines:

```
Create modern authentication pages for ReadStack, a URL manager app.

PAGES NEEDED:
- Login page with email/password
- Signup page with email, password, confirm password
- Password reset page

DESIGN:
- shadcn/ui components (v0 includes everything)
- Purple/indigo primary (reading/knowledge theme)
- Clean, minimal, focused on readability
- Mobile responsive
- Form validation errors inline
- Loading states for form submission
- "Remember me" checkbox on login

Style: Clean, minimal SaaS aesthetic
```

Click "Generate" (bottom right).

![Screenshot: v0 auth prompt pasted](#placeholder-v0-auth-prompt)

### Wait 10-20 Seconds

v0 generates three pages.

![Screenshot: v0 generating](#placeholder-v0-generating)

### Review the Result

**You'll see:**
- Three tabs: Login, Signup, Reset Password
- Forms with proper styling
- Buttons with hover states
- Validation indicators
- Mobile and desktop views

**Check mobile view:** Click the phone icon (bottom left).

![Screenshot: v0 auth result](#placeholder-v0-auth-result)

### Not Perfect? Refine It

If something needs adjustment:

1. Click "Refine" (top right)
2. Describe the change: "Make the buttons larger and use darker purple"
3. Click "Generate"

v0 updates the design in 10 seconds.

![Screenshot: v0 refine](#placeholder-v0-refine)

### Export the Code

When satisfied:

1. Click "Copy Code" (top right)
2. The code is now on your clipboard

Don't paste it anywhere yet. We'll organize it later.

---

## Component 2: Dashboard

### Start New Design

Click "New" again (v0 logo, top left).

### Paste This Prompt

```
Create the main dashboard for ReadStack, a personal URL manager.

LAYOUT:
- Header: ReadStack logo, search bar, "Save URL" button (primary action)
- Three tabs: "To Read", "Reading", "Archive"
- Stats cards: Total Saved, This Month, Completed, Avg Rating
- Article grid (2-3 columns desktop, 1 column mobile)

ARTICLE CARDS:
- Preview image (gradient fallback if no image)
- Title (bold, 2 lines max)
- Description (gray, 3 lines max)
- URL domain (small, subtle)
- Tags as colored badges
- Status badge
- Hover: action buttons (Move to Reading, Archive, Delete)

FEATURES:
- User menu (avatar, settings, logout)
- Empty state with "Save your first article" CTA
- Mobile responsive

Use shadcn/ui. Modern cards with subtle shadows.
```

Click "Generate".

![Screenshot: v0 dashboard prompt](#placeholder-v0-dashboard-prompt)

### Review the Result

**You'll see:**
- Complete dashboard layout
- Article cards in grid
- Stats showing numbers
- Tabs for filtering
- Responsive design

**Test the interactive elements:**
- Click tabs (they switch)
- Hover over cards (actions appear)
- Check mobile view

![Screenshot: v0 dashboard result](#placeholder-v0-dashboard-result)

### Refine if Needed

Common refinements:
- "Make article cards more compact"
- "Use a lighter background color"
- "Make the 'Save URL' button more prominent"

### Export the Code

Click "Copy Code".

---

## Component 3: Save URL Dialog

### Start New Design

Click "New".

### Paste This Prompt

```
Create a "Save URL" dialog modal for ReadStack.

DIALOG CONTENTS:
- Large URL input (auto-focus, placeholder: "Paste URL here...")
- After URL entered, show:
  - Auto-fetched title (editable)
  - Auto-fetched description (editable)
  - Preview image thumbnail
  - Tags input (multi-select chips)
  - Notes textarea (optional)
  - Status dropdown: To Read (default), Reading, Archive
- Cancel and Save buttons

FEATURES:
- Loading state while fetching metadata
- Error state if URL invalid
- Success animation on save
- Keyboard shortcuts (Cmd+Enter to save, Esc to close)
- Full screen on mobile, centered on desktop

Use shadcn/ui dialog, input, textarea, badge components.
```

Click "Generate".

![Screenshot: v0 dialog prompt](#placeholder-v0-dialog-prompt)

### Review the Result

**You'll see:**
- Modal dialog
- URL input field
- All form fields shown
- Loading states
- Mobile and desktop versions

![Screenshot: v0 dialog result](#placeholder-v0-dialog-result)

### Refine if Needed

Common refinements:
- "Make the URL input larger"
- "Show the preview image bigger"
- "Add icons to the buttons"

### Export the Code

Click "Copy Code".

---

## Component 4: Article Detail Page

### Start New Design

Click "New".

### Paste This Prompt

```
Create an article detail page for ReadStack.

LAYOUT:
- Back button (top left)
- Article preview image (hero, full width, 300px height)
- Title (large, editable inline on click)
- Original URL link (opens in new tab)
- Status dropdown and rating (1-5 stars)
- Tags (editable chips)
- Notes section (large textarea, auto-save on blur)
- Metadata: Saved date, Read date (if archived)
- Action buttons: "Mark as Read", "Archive", "Delete" (with confirmation)

FEATURES:
- Edit any field inline (click to edit)
- Auto-save changes (show "Saving..." indicator)
- Delete confirmation dialog
- "Open Original" button (prominent)

Use shadcn/ui. Reading-focused design, good typography, mobile responsive.
```

Click "Generate".

![Screenshot: v0 detail prompt](#placeholder-v0-detail-prompt)

### Review the Result

**You'll see:**
- Full article detail page
- Editable fields
- Rating stars
- Tag chips
- Action buttons
- Responsive layout

![Screenshot: v0 detail result](#placeholder-v0-detail-result)

### Refine if Needed

Common refinements:
- "Make the title font larger"
- "Add more spacing between sections"
- "Make tags more colorful"

### Export the Code

Click "Copy Code".

---

## What You Have Now

**Four v0 designs exported:**
1. Authentication pages
2. Dashboard
3. Save URL dialog
4. Article detail page

**All code is on your clipboard** (most recent export).

Don't worry - v0 saves your designs. You can re-export any of them:

1. Click "History" (left sidebar)
2. Find the design
3. Click it
4. Click "Copy Code" again

![Screenshot: v0 history](#placeholder-v0-history)

## Common Questions

**Q: Can I modify the v0 code after export?**

Yes. It's regular React/Next.js code. You own it. But try to get the design right in v0 first - it's faster than manual editing.

**Q: What if I don't like v0's design choices?**

Use "Refine" with specific requests. Examples:
- "Use a different color scheme - green and white"
- "Make everything 20% larger"
- "Use cards instead of a list layout"

**Q: Can I use v0 designs in production?**

Yes. The code is yours. v0 free tier has usage limits, but exported code has no restrictions.

**Q: What if v0 generates code that doesn't work?**

Rare, but possible. Usually it's because:
1. Missing dependencies (install them)
2. Environment differences (adjust imports)
3. Edge case in the prompt (refine the prompt)

You'll fix these in Chapter 15.

**Q: Should I understand all the generated code?**

Not yet. You'll understand it as you integrate and modify it. For now, trust that it works.
